com.ibm.icu.util
Class TimeArrayTimeZoneRule

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZoneRule
      com.ibm.icu.util.TimeArrayTimeZoneRule

public class TimeArrayTimeZoneRule
extends TimeZoneRule

TimeArrayTimeZoneRule represents a time zone rule whose start times are defined by an array of milliseconds since the standard base time.

Constructor Summary
TimeArrayTimeZoneRule(java.lang.String name, int stdOffset, int dstSaving, long[] startTimes)
          Constructs a TimeArrayTimeZoneRule with the name, the GMT offset of its standard time, the amount of daylight saving offset adjustment and the array of times when this rule takes effect.

          Gets the very last time when this rule starts.
 java.util.Date getFirstStart()
          Gets the very first time when this rule starts.
 java.util.Date getNextStart(long base)
          Gets the time when this rule starts after the specified time.

Constructor Detail

TimeArrayTimeZoneRule

public TimeArrayTimeZoneRule(java.lang.String name,
                             int stdOffset,
                             int dstSaving,
                             long[] startTimes)
Constructs a TimeArrayTimeZoneRule with the name, the GMT offset of its standard time, the amount of daylight saving offset adjustment and the array of times when this rule takes effect.

Parameters:
name - The time zone name.
stdOffset - The GMT offset of its standard time in milliseconds.
dstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset adjustment in milliseconds. If this ia a rule for standard time, the value of this argument is 0.
startTimes - The start times in milliseconds since the base time (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT).
Method Detail

getFirstStart

public java.util.Date getFirstStart()
Gets the very first time when this rule starts.

Returns:
The very first time when this rule takes starts, or null if this rule is an initial rule.

getFinalStart

public java.util.Date getFinalStart()
Gets the very last time when this rule starts.

Returns:
The very last time when this rule starts, or null if this rule is an initial rule.

getNextStart

public java.util.Date getNextStart(long base)
Gets the time when this rule starts after the specified time.

Parameters:
base - The first time after this time is returned. The base time is exclusive.
Returns:
The first time when this rule starts after the specified time, or null when this rule never starts after the specified time.
